com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.testframework

Class SDKAssertion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.testframework.SDKAssertion

  • public class SDKAssertion
extends Object
    The standard assertion class to verify the result of custom step execution.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SDKAssertion assertArgumentValue(int argumentIndex, String expectedValue)
      Assert the argument value retrieved based on the supplied argument index with the given expectedValue.
      SDKAssertion assertCacheIsValid(String cacheName)
      Assert that the cache is still valid by calling Cache.isValid() method.
      SDKAssertion assertCacheValue(String cacheName, String cacheKey, String expectedCacheValue)
      Assert expectedCacheValue against actual cache value derived from the cacheKey and cacheName.
      SDKAssertion assertColumnName(int columnIndex, String expectedColumnName)
      Compare the expected column name against the actual column name based on the column index.
      SDKAssertion assertColumnSize(int expectedColumnSize)
      Compare the expectedColumnSize with the StepOutput's column size.
      SDKAsyncAssertion assertColumnValueAt(long rowIndex, int columnIndex, Object expectedValue)
      assert the value retrieved based on the supplied row and column index with the given expectedValue.
      SDKAssertion assertExecutedRowCount(long expectedRowCount)
      Assert the expectedRowCount against the row that is processed by StepOutput.execute method.
      SDKAssertion assertServerProperty(String serverPropertyKey, Object expectedServerPropertyValue)
      Assert a value returned based on serverPropertyKey against expectedServerPropertyValue.
      SDKAssertion assertThatAllRowsIsExecuted()
      assert that all rows from the input is executed based on the number of input rows compared against the row(s) that are processed by StepOutput.execute.
      SDKAsyncAssertion assertWithCsvOutput(String csvPath)
      Assert the output with expected CSV file.
      SDKAssertion closeCustomStep()
      Close custom step.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • assertThatAllRowsIsExecuted

        public SDKAssertion assertThatAllRowsIsExecuted()
        assert that all rows from the input is executed based on the number of input rows compared against the row(s) that are processed by StepOutput.execute.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertExecutedRowCount

        public SDKAssertion assertExecutedRowCount(long expectedRowCount)
        Assert the expectedRowCount against the row that is processed by StepOutput.execute method.
        Parameters:
        expectedRowCount - expected row count returned by StepOutput.execute() call.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertColumnSize

        public SDKAssertion assertColumnSize(int expectedColumnSize)
        Compare the expectedColumnSize with the StepOutput's column size.
        Parameters:
        expectedColumnSize - expected column size of the StepOutput.getColumns()
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertColumnName

        public SDKAssertion assertColumnName(int columnIndex,
                                     String expectedColumnName)
        Compare the expected column name against the actual column name based on the column index.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - step output's column manager's column index.
        expectedColumnName - to be compared against the actual column name.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertColumnValueAt

        public SDKAsyncAssertion assertColumnValueAt(long rowIndex,
                                             int columnIndex,
                                             Object expectedValue)
        assert the value retrieved based on the supplied row and column index with the given expectedValue.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - row index - to extract the actual value from the execution result.
        columnIndex - column index - to extract the actual value from the execution result.
        expectedValue - expected value of the particular coordinate (based on rowIndex and columnIndex above).
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertServerProperty

        public SDKAssertion assertServerProperty(String serverPropertyKey,
                                         Object expectedServerPropertyValue)
        Assert a value returned based on serverPropertyKey against expectedServerPropertyValue.
        Parameters:
        serverPropertyKey - key to fetch the corresponding server property.
        expectedServerPropertyValue - expected server property value to be compared against the actual server property.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • closeCustomStep

        public SDKAssertion closeCustomStep()
        Close custom step.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertCacheIsValid

        public SDKAssertion assertCacheIsValid(String cacheName)
        Assert that the cache is still valid by calling Cache.isValid() method.
        Parameters:
        cacheName - cache name to be asserted
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertCacheValue

        public SDKAssertion assertCacheValue(String cacheName,
                                     String cacheKey,
                                     String expectedCacheValue)
        Assert expectedCacheValue against actual cache value derived from the cacheKey and cacheName.
        Parameters:
        cacheName - cache name to be asserted.
        cacheKey - cache key to get the corresponding value.
        expectedCacheValue - expected cache value to be compared against the actual cache value.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertArgumentValue

        public SDKAssertion assertArgumentValue(int argumentIndex,
                                        String expectedValue)
        Assert the argument value retrieved based on the supplied argument index with the given expectedValue.
        Parameters:
        argumentIndex - argument index - to extract the actual value from the execution result.
        expectedValue - expected argument value.
        Returns:
        SDKAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • assertWithCsvOutput

        public SDKAsyncAssertion assertWithCsvOutput(String csvPath)
        Assert the output with expected CSV file. It will assert row count, column count, column names and all the values. This method is asynchronous to simulate the behavior of Aperture Data Studio. Follow up with SDKAsyncAssertion.waitForAssertion to make sure that all assertion has been run.
        Parameters:
        csvPath - the expected CSV output file
        Returns:
        SDKAsyncAssertion return itself - so that it can be chained with other assertion method.
